medical_history.chief_complaint: Short long bones suggestive of lethal skeletal dysplasia observed via fetal ultrasound.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In the first trimester, increased nuchal translucency (3.1 mm) and nuchal fold thickness (5.3 mm) were noted at 14 weeks. By 20 weeks, ultrasound revealed bilateral short femur length (1.55 cm), tibia (1.28 cm), humerus (1.39 cm), radius (1.56 cm), and ulna (1.59 cm), indicating significant skeletal abnormalities.
